cells.data:
Am taking a tutorial on building a game character in Blender from scratch. This is a very complex project that I think will take a very long time. I have tried this kind of thing before with little success. Thought I would try it again and document the process and in particular track the time it took to do it.

Started with a circle and built out from the eye. Here is where I am at the moment.


Am tracking each section separately. This is the face section. I am 2 hours and 4 minutes into this section,
and 2 hours and 4 minutes total.

Extending the face downward by extruding the selected vertices:



Expanding the face upward for the forehead and backwards towards the ears.
1 hour 10 minutes today with 3 hours 16 minutes total.



Only modeling what is visible in the character as the rest of the face is hidden. Not doing the eyeball, which is a bit difficult. Here it is as the moment.
Have used 45 minutes for this with a total time of 3 hours and 55 minutes.



Have completed the eyes by applying rotation and scale, setting the center point of the eye to 0,0,0 and
adding a mirror modifier. This completes the face as we are only modeling what shows outside the mask and hood.



This took 34 minutes with a total of  4 hours 30 minutes for the project.
